Hello and welcome to the <#955463647918981150> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314> 

Feel free to reach out to the WalletConnect Team at any point with your questions! 

Just giving you all a quick snapshot for you to get quickly acquainted!


üëÄ **ABOUT** 
**WalletConnect** is the web3 standard for connecting blockchain wallets to dapps. We offer SDKs and infrastructure to provide wallets with more interoperability. Our protocol enables a secure connection between a dapp and a wallet that a user can expose its blockchain accounts and sign messages and transactions.

Learn more: https://walletconnect.com/


üèÜ **PRIZE OVERVIEW **
** DeFi Track**
ü•á 1st - $4,000
ü•à 2nd - $2,000
ü•â 3rd - $1,000

**Social Track**
ü•á 1st - $4,000
ü•à 2nd - $2,000
ü•â 3rd - $1,000

üèä **Pool Prize** - $2,000 to honorable mentions that have full integration with WalletConnect

**‚Üì Full Prize Breakdown Here ‚Üì **
https://ethamsterdam.ethglobal.com/prizes/


üöÄ **WORKSHOP** 
**How to connect your dapp with WalletConnect**
Friday, April 22 @ 17:00
w/ Pedro Gomes


üîó **IMPORTANT LINKS**
https://docs.walletconnect.com/
Hey, is there any sample code for connecting 2 wallets to 1 app?
e.g. App on laptop, 1 wallet on Rainbow/iPhone, 1 wallet on WallETH/Android. For e.g. paired programming in Remix, two-player games, etc.
You can definitely connect 2 wallets to 1 app
However it definitely requires some hacking around it
you can pass a variable named `storageId` which by default is set to "walletconnect"
however since you are customizing the `storageId` then you will need to track the custom storageId's you have created to re-intializes clients
PS - we have improved this experience significantly for v2.0 so the example above is only applicable for v1.0
For all the Flutter devs out there, check out: https://github.com/Orange-Wallet/wallet-connect-dart

Don't miss out the WalletConnect workshop TODAY

**How to connect your dapp with WalletConnect**
Friday, April 22 @ 17:00
w/ Pedro Gomes

Generating JWT tokens from ETH signatures

https://github.com/0xsequence/ethauth.js

For those that might have missed the WalletConnect workshop you can watch the recording here

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qCdAc3KCEmg
PS - you can watch it from the beggining up to min 34:20
Hey, have anyone encountered this problem? I'm using `@web3-react/walletconnect-connector` and this is thrown in that library
it's thrown in the `activate` function for the connector

Hey walletConnect team, sorry for bugging u at that time but we have an error we need to fix and we believe it might be a problem in ur sdk. We r trying to sign a contract via ethers-rs and we get the following error message. Would be rly great if u could help!
Hey <@240486346848731136> we actually are not aware exactly where activate is being under web3-react but you can also our provider separately

Unsure how it affects our sdk, but I could be wrong‚Ä¶

However I do recognize that error message from ethers so you should look into using a sanitize hex util to make sure all inputs have 0x prefix encoded
thx for ur answer. We try to debug more.
We changed parcel to webpack and it worked üëåüèª

Hello and welcome to the <#955463647918981150> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314> 

Feel free to reach out to the WalletConnect team at any point with your questions! 

Just giving you all a quick snapshot for you to get quickly acquainted!


üëÄ** ABOUT **
**WalletConnect** is the web3 standard for connecting blockchain wallets to dapps. We offer SDKs and infrastructure to provide wallets with more interoperability. Our protocol enables a secure connection between a dapp and a wallet that a user can expose its blockchain accounts and sign messages and transactions.

Learn more: https://walletconnect.com/

Hi its a social focused track but still focused on DeFi projects built on HackMoney.
Hi there, is there a change log available to compare v1.0 vs v2.0?

No changelog at this time, as v2 is still in development. Best way to compare both would be through githubs history https://github.com/WalletConnect/walletconnect-monorepo/compare/v1.0...v2.0 but there is a lot to unpack there üòÖ
hahhaha, no worries it's on the doc, I believe that'd be better to use v2 on our side because we do already implement v1.

Hi wallet connect team, quick question. What's the relationship between WC and web3modal? Are they alternatives? I saw web3modal supports WC, but since WC is not a wallet but an integration/messaging service I'm a bit confused

Web3Modal makes it easier to integrate WalletConnect and other wallet providers like Metamask and Coinbase Wallet

WalletConnect is not a wallet but is supported by more than 100 wallets to connect to your dapp

Maybe we could in the future‚Ä¶ WalletConnect 2.0 is designed to use multi-chain with chain-agnostic interfaces which will describe new methods for basic EVMs and more extended EVMs

Hey <@292230513177919488> , hope all is well. Our teams building a decentralized protocol for scheduling token transfers. It‚Äôs meant to be a public utility for the polygon network. Any dApps/devs could integrate it into their existing DeFi wallets, yields farms, etc. do you think this would be helpful ?
Hi WalletConnect team
I am having one question. If we are using Moralis to make use of WalletConnect are we still gonna be eligible for the prize?
I guess it will depend how its designed but as concept I believe it‚Äôs valuable
That‚Äôs correct‚Ä¶ you can use any library you want to support WalletConnect and be eligible for the sponsor bounties
Any specific design details that you believe would need to be the most polished ?

Without knowing much about your project, I would consider the following:
- will this work with any Ethereum wallet? Smart Contract Wallets? Seed Phrase Wallets?
- who's responsible for the execution of the scheduled token transfers? Tx Relayer? Wallet Provider? Dapp?
- will there be a single implementation on-chain or will each wallet have to deploy its own? Read for example about EIP-3074 which is designed to have a single invoker contract
- can users cancel their scheduled transactions? If so, do they just need to sign a message like before or need to send a transaction on-chain?
Hey, any way that I can make the project or web3modal work with Svelte using rollup? I'm struggling a lot üò¶
Does this default js usage work for your case? https://github.com/Web3Modal/web3modal#using-in-vanilla-javascript

There is also a demo for using it with vite as bundler and this one includes rollupOptions
https://github.com/Web3Modal/web3modal#using-with-vite
I have a question from a UX perspective. In terms of the business end of wallet connect, how basic does that look in terms of how you can look at what users have connected their wallet, etc.
You could push them to an array as people connect

I‚Äôve got a lot of questions about WalletConnect. Sorry I missed the workshop.

Right now it‚Äôs giving me the QR code in my terminal on provider.enable().. how can I put it in an image instead?

Hi Javyer, regarding your original question of Svelte with rollup, here's a codesandbox with rollup+svelte with a working implementation of your code (I just copied it into the `web3Modal.js` file and used `connect` on the button):
https://codesandbox.io/s/sad-butterfly-qq5rku?file=/web3Modal.js
The rollup config is as-is from the codesandbox template, so it seems it handles the polyfilling of node dependencies (i.e. `util`) already out of the box
Thank you for doing that! I'm working with typescript, could that be the problem?

I created the same repo in TS and it is not working: https://github.com/Bullrich/walletconnect-svelte-ts

Could you tell me if you have the same problem on your side?

Hi Autocrat, based on your description I'm assuming you're using the `@walletconnect/web3-provider` pkg for your use case. If you want to produce a custom QRCode image, you could listen for the `display_uri` event on the provider and then generate one suited to your needs (this is also how the qrcode-modal does this internally via the external `qrcode` pkg).

I put together a quick sandbox with the default provider example + a listener for the `display_uri` event:
https://codesandbox.io/s/musing-raman-86q8qh?file=/src/App.js

Here's how the QRCode modal generates the QRCode SVG internally, which may help as a reference point:
https://github.com/WalletConnect/walletconnect-monorepo/blob/v1.0/packages/helpers/qrcode-modal/src/browser/components/QRCodeDisplay.tsx#L12

Hope that helps!

Hmm I had a quick try of this locally and it's also erroring for me. The rollup config seems to be quite different here though. Maybe try simply adding the typescript rollup plugin to a local clone of codesandbox example since that one already works?
That‚Äôs the default roll up plugin provided by svelte when you port the project to ts
Sorry I'm also not sure what the exact issue is for that config, I need to tackle some other things on my side for now but can try to dig deeper later today

Thank you!
To setup a new project run `npx degit sveltejs/template walletconnect-test && cd walletconnect-test && node scripts/setupTypeScript.js` and you'll have the project set up to work with Typescript.

After that I just installed the rest of the stuff (`npm install --save web3modal @walletconnect/web3-provider`) and added the connection class.

-Am using vuejs and had to install these packages `yarn add stream-browserify url assert util stream-http https-browserify os-browserify buffer` and add them as polyfills to the config file as it states here in the second to last answer by mikjakbiak : https://github.com/Web3Modal/web3modal/issues/317

Hi exclusiveoranges,
Your code seems to work as-is for me, as you can see in the following codesandbox:
https://codesandbox.io/s/headless-resonance-lr96c7?file=/src/User.js

The only thing I altered was using an infura ID explicitly rather than from environment variables.
The only immediate reason I can see why the WalletConnect or Coinbase modals won't open is if the Infura ID is not defined. So it may be worth checking if those are properly defined in your next.js environment (e.g. via `console.log` in your code). 
If that's not it, please provide us a reproduction of the issue or the errors you're seeing on your side

Hey <@130774012325265409> <@215776216215584768> <@130774012325265409> üëã 
We have submitted the project (MeTag)üöÄ  

We created an amazing use case of WalletConnect and its web3modal- namely, integrating them with a wearable stylish hardware device. Our unique wearable device with ingrained QR code, WalletConnect, and web3modal come together to simplify the user registration and payment process drastically. 

Name: MeTag
Showcase Link: https://showcase.ethglobal.com/hackmoney2022/metag-nc54i

About MeTag:
MeTag is the next gen. product that would enable users to share their public keys and socials and pay in crypto without any hassle of taking out their phone or using any other platform to share to believe on. We are creating a very stylish tag with a QR embedded on it, which would have all the public keys/ socials/ eth linked. With the help of this, they could connect with people more quickly, and MeTag makes connecting in the new era easier and futuristic. 

We are looking forward to use WalletConnet in a more better and impactful way! üíØ 

Thanks,
Vansh

Hello and welcome to the <#955463647918981150> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314> 

Feel free to reach out to the WalletConnect Team at any point with your questions!
